findings.title: Incorrect calculation of user’s token percentage in multiple functions.
findings.description: The implementation of calculating user's token balance percentage with respect to total supply of STYK is incorrect and can have a major impact on the contract’s internal ledger for user’s funds.

findings.title: Re-entrancy in STYKRewardsPayOuts() function.
findings.description: In the STYKRewardsPayOuts() function of STYK contract, an external call for ETH transfer is performed to distribute rewards to users. However the function's implementation is incorrect and opens up a possible attack vector for reentrancy attack.

findings.title: Anyone can change the token name and symbol.
findings.description: Any Ethereum user can call setName() and setSymbol() functions and can set any string value as name and symbol of the STYK token.

findings.title: Looping through unbounded arrays.
findings.description: The STYKRewardsPayOuts function of STYK contract loops through an unbounded array userAddress twice which can become an issue when the number of elements in the array becomes large.
